text: The presence of a host-derived envelope, and the envelope structure if present, are characteristic of related viruses.
The protein capsid or core particle may be helical or icosahedral, with various levels of symmetry.

Related viruses generally share the same size range; for example, enteroviruses such as poliovirus are only 30 nm across (about the size of a ribosome), whereas poxviruses are 200–400 nm, as large as a small bacterium.
